comment._content: Poor little blighters must have had a tough time of it.

comment.author: 64478571@N07
comment._content: Second row from front, second boy on right looks like me but I don't think I am quite that old ---- or am I, Can't remember! Anyway I think I was never in the Andrew.

comment.author: 26093461@N00
comment._content: What does '2nd class boys' mean in this context?

comment.author: 40359244@N02
comment._content:
From a Wikipedia article on former ranks in the Royal Navy:

Boy 2nd class - a boy aged 15 to 17 rated as such on entry to a training ship of the Royal Navy. Such entry was conditional on a boy's adequate physical height, weight and medical fitness and evidence of being of 'good character'. The boy's parents or guardians would sign a declaration that the boy would serve in the navy for a minimum period (usually 12 years).

comment.author: 34674982@N07
comment._content: And in Australia from the early sixties until the 1980's we had Junior Recruits, boys aged 15.5 - 16.5 who signed on for 12 years and began with a year training at HMAS Leeuwin  in Western Australia (and some early boys in HMAS Cerberus in Victoria).  Sad that those days are gone. I joined at 15 in 1967 and do not regret a day of my 25 years!
